units.title: Induce scarring with doxycycline
units.text: Scarring is induced at different time points of organoid development through doxycycline (dox) induction of Cas9.
units.rationale: Specifies how to trigger barcode generation during organoid growth.

units.title: Introduce iTracer construct
units.text: The iTracer construct is introduced by electroporation into iPSCs that contain a doxycycline-inducible Cas9 cassette (iCRISPR).
units.rationale: Describes the method for delivering the lineage recorder into stem cells.

units.title: Isolate reporter‑positive cells
units.text: Fluorescent cells containing the reporter can be isolated using flow cytometry before being propagated or cryopreserved for later use.
units.rationale: Ensures selection of cells that carry the functional recorder.

units.title: Initiate cerebral organoids
units.text: From these uniquely barcoded iPSCs, we initiate cerebral organoids using approximately 2,000 cells to record lineages during organoid development (Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Defines the starting cell number for organoid formation with lineage tags.

units.title: Activate Cas9 expression
units.text: Doxycycline introduction into the medium induces Cas9 expression in organoid cells, followed by formation of Cas9–gRNA complexes, leading to double‑stranded break formation at the target location in the fluorescent reporter region of the recorder.
units.rationale: Outlines the molecular cascade that creates scar barcodes.

units.title: Generate scar barcodes
units.text: These breaks are repaired by cellular machinery, resulting in insertions and/or deletions at the cut site, so‑called scars, which serve as a second channel of our lineage recorder and can be read by sequencing the reporter transcript.
units.rationale: Explains how scars become readable lineage markers.

units.title: Track barcode diversity over time
units.text: We followed barcode diversity throughout organoid development using targeted amplicon sequencing of the barcode region (Extended Data Fig. 1b,c).
units.rationale: Provides a method to monitor barcode evolution during differentiation.

units.title: Optimize doxycycline conditions
units.text: We tested the duration and concentration of doxycycline treatment; we found scarring was most efficient when samples were incubated with 8 µg ml−1 doxycycline for 24 h and applied these conditions in all subsequent experiments.
units.rationale: Establishes the optimal induction parameters for consistent scarring.

units.title: Quantify barcode library size
units.text: We measured barcode diversity using scRNA‑seq data from three iTracer iPSC pools and found approximately 60,000 unique sequences.
units.rationale: Assesses the complexity of the barcode pool to ensure sufficient resolution.
